How to Wipe a Mac Clean (with Pictures) - wikiHow

 Desktop Site   
 Community Tested How to Wipe a Mac Clean   
 This wikiHow teaches you how to delete all the data, files, applications, and settings on your Mac computer. 
 Steps Edit 
 Method One of Two: OS X 10.7 or Later Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3c\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 1 
 Back up any data you want to save .  Wiping your Mac will erase everything, including your operating system, so keeping a backup on an external hard drive or DVD is a good idea.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4e\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4e\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-2-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Open the Apple menu.  It's the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9d\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9d\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-3-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 3 
 Click on  Restart… .  It's near the bottom of the menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-4-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click  Restart  to confirm.  This immediately shuts down and reboots your Mac.
 Wait for your Mac to shut down. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-5-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Press and hold  ⌘ + R  as the Mac restarts. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/00\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-6-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Release the keys when you see the Apple logo.  The "macOS Utilities" window will appear.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e8\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e8\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-7-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Click on  Disk Utility .  It's at the bottom of the list.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/60\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-8-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 Click on  Continue .  It's in the lower-right corner of the window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-9-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-9-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 Click on your Mac's hard drive.  It's in the upper-left of the window, under "Internal."
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/23\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-10-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/23\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-10-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 Click on  Erase .  It's a button at the top-center of the window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c0\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-11-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c0\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-11-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 11 
 Name your disk.  Type it in the "Name:" field.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-12-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/75\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-12-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 12 
 Click on the "Format: " drop-down menu.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f8\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-13-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f8\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-13-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 13 
 Select a format.  To reinstall a MacOS system, select:
 Mac OS Extended (Journaled)  for the fastest wipe. 
 Mac OS Extended (Journaled, Encrypted)  for a more secure wipe. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7d\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-14-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7d\/Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Wipe-a-Mac-Clean-Step-14-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 14 
 Click on  Erase .  It's in the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The wipe process will begin.
 The time to erase your disk will vary based on disk size, the amount of data stored, and whether your chose an encrypted format. 
 Advertisement 
 Method Two of Two: OS X 10.6 or Earlier Edit 
 1 
 Back up any data you want to save .  Wiping your Mac will erase everything, including your operating system, so keeping a backup on an external hard drive or DVD is a good idea. 
 2 
 Insert your installation disc.  Insert the installation DVD or CD that came with your computer into the computer's disc drive and wait for the computer to recognize the disc.
 If you are using a USB drive instead of an installation disc, insert the USB drive. 
 3 
 Open the Apple menu.  It's the black apple icon in the upper-left corner of the screen. 
 4 
 Click on  Restart… .  It's near the bottom of the menu. 
 5 
 Click  Restart  to confirm.  This immediately shuts down and reboots your Mac.
 Wait for your Mac to shut down. 
 6 
 Press and hold  C  as the Mac restarts. 
 If you are using a USB drive instead of an installation disc, hold down  ⌥  Option  instead. 
 7 
 Open  Disk Utility .  It's located in the "Utilities" section of the Installation menu. 
 8 
 Click on your Mac's hard drive.  It's in the upper-left of the window, under "Internal." 
 9 
 Click the  Erase  tab.  It's at the top of the page. 
 10 
 Name your disk.  Type it in the "Name:" field. 
 11 
 Click on the "Format: " drop-down menu. 
 12 
 Select a format.  If you plan to reinstall OS X, select:  Mac OS X Extended (Journaled) . 
 13 
 Click on  Erase .  It's in the lower-right corner of the dialog box. The wipe process will begin.
 The time to erase your disk will vary based on disk size and the amount of data that was stored on your hard drive. 
 Advertisement 
 Community Q&A 
 Search 
 Add New Question 
 Why would I get a question mark after wiping a hard drive? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 During start up? You didn't re-Install OSX. When In the Command+R menu, click reinstall OSX. 
 Thanks! 
 9 
 0 
 Will this not affect my other laptop which has the same data? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 If the data is located/stored in the cloud, and the laptop is not accessing the data directly from the cleaned Mac, the other laptop should not be affected. 
 Thanks! 
 7 
 1 
 What should I do - when I turn on my Mac, nothing is left, only the drive? 
								Answered by  
								 Lucian Lees   
 You didn't re-install OSX. You have to go to Safari (default app on a Mac), and get a browser, like Chrome. Go to the Command+R menu, and click Re-Install OSX. 
 Thanks! 
 6 
 1 
 How to install OS on an erased MacBook? 
								Answered by  
								 Lucian Lees   
 When you go back to that main screen you get when you go to the OSX utilities (Command+R), you click "Reinstall OSX". 
 Thanks! 
 1 
 0 
 My Mac won't boot up. Can I wipe it from another machine? 
								Answered by  
								 Lucian Lees   
 No. You have to wipe that drive. The only thing you would be able to wipe are iCloud files from another computer. 
 Thanks! 
 1 
 0 
 Do I have to install the extra software? Can I just skip it? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 You don't need to reinstall anything; if, for example, you are selling it. If you are still keeping it, it's your choice. 
 Thanks! 
 1 
 0 
 The utilities window is not showing up when I hold Command+R down during reboot. What should I do? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Hold it down as soon as you see the Apple symbol. Keep holding it and don't let go. 
 Thanks! 
 1 
 1 
 I am trying to reinstall OS but keyboard isn't working and I cannot log into Apple ID to install OS? 
 Answer 
 What if I don't have the installation disk? 
 Answer 
 I did everything but after erasing I restarted the Mac and After restarting the Mac it shows the prohibition sign . Do I need to insert the cd which I don't have?  
 Answer 
 It says I can't unmount the disk. What do I do? 
 Answer
